header_summary:
Moonsettler highlighted the need for open dialogue within the Bitcoin Development Mailing List to correct the misinterpretation of a table as a broad consensus, emphasizing the importance of dynamic discussions for a nuanced understanding of group consensus. This approach is aimed at fostering thoughtful evaluations among members ([Source](https://gnusha.org/pi/bitcoindev/6Jm_AoIIskhEfyAwJFVFmzzA1iJJ3h51yCC8TwgO_MhV-ARzL9s7fVynKdN0-rNqNrN3kYsklxTZDGuko8LMsT0SW-Idy7tdA_u_e0s_Zsk=@protonmail.com/T/#mb82be7810027f64d8ab0ec6a59ba3d8c7c4b91ec)).

Ian Quantum discussed the challenges and progress in quantum-resistant cryptography, highlighting the formalization of CRYSTALS-Dilithium, CRYSTALS-KYBER, and SPHINCS+ as standards by NIST in 2024 and the development of a FIPS incorporating FALCON's digital signature algorithm. This conversation underscores the urgent need for the Bitcoin code to migrate to quantum-resistant protocols in light of advancements in quantum computing, such as an algorithm capable of breaking ECC-256 encryption in just 9 hours ([NIST Announcement](https://csrc.nist.gov/News/2024/postquantum-cryptography-fips-approved)), ([Alice and Bob's Research](https://alice-bob.com/blog/computing-256-bit-elliptic-curve-logarithm-in-9-hours-with-126133-cat-qubits/)).

A proposal to enhance Bitcoin's resilience against control and censorship by utilizing the "nLockTime" feature in transactions to prioritize their inclusion in blocks was introduced, suggesting a more nuanced transaction selection process within the mempool. This proposal aims to balance efficiency with fairness, ensuring transactions with older timestamps have a chance of being included despite lower fees, thereby advocating for a cooperative approach within the blockchain ecosystem ([Source](https://gnusha.org/pi/bitcoindev/f1a0153b-3142-4e01-a68e-92c458762b89@dashjr.org/T/#m79b93d3c8f40715707d41cd1b4a2e8158496005e)).

Ademan proposed a multi-party eltoo scheme with mechanisms to penalize dishonest behavior and ensure bounded settlement times, addressing vulnerabilities in the naive eltoo protocol. This proposal, which relies on the anticipated LNHANCE soft fork for new opcodes, represents a collaborative effort to enhance blockchain protocols, inviting further feedback and testing within the community ([Source](https://delvingbitcoin.org/t/multi-party-eltoo-with-bounded-settlement/1364)).

active_posts.summary:
